description: Of uncertain origin. Possible alteration of tug (“to pull”) +‎ -le

entries.meaning: (nautical) A wooden or metal pin, short rod, crosspiece or similar, fixed transversely in the eye of a rope or chain to be secured to any other loop, ring, or bight, e.g. a sea painter to a lifeboat.
(in particular, fashion) A rod-shaped button bound with slack to the fabric.
An appliance for transmitting force at right angles to its direction.
A horizontal piece of wood that is placed on a door, flat, or other wooden structure, but is not on one of the edges of the structure.
A fastener that has flaps that align vertically to penetrate a surface and then spread out to secure the fastener in position, e.g. a molly bolt.
(skydiving) A loop of webbing or a dowel affixed to the end of the steering/brake lines of a parachute providing the pilot with a means of control.

verbs.description: toggle (third-person singular simple present toggles, present participle toggling, simple past and past participle toggled)

entries.meaning: To alternate between two positions using a single switch or lever.
examples: Clicking a button will alternately toggle its light on OR off.
You can quickly toggle the case of selected text by pressing Alt+C.

entries.meaning: (nautical, transitive) To fix like a toggle iron; to fix fast.
